title: Who's my favorite subnet?
options: DHCP runs over UDP
The destination IPv4 for DHCP “discover” is 255.255.255.255
The destination IPv4 for DHCP “offer” is 0.0.0.0
None of the above

title: Make sure to handshake with everyone
options: We lose the ability to use ciphers since we use them as an IV for CBC
It helps us generate pseudorandom keys
There's nothing stopping an attacker from repeating the handshake
There's literally no point to nonces

title: Trusting all authority?
options: We lose the ability to use elliptic curves since we don't have a public key to use
If we don't sign with a certificate authority, we can't encrypt our data
Since the client also self-signs, there's no problem for the server to do so as well
How does the client know that the server really is the server?
